Package nl.tudelft.jpacman

Class Launcher

java.lang.Object
nl.tudelft.jpacman.Launcher
public class Launcher extends Object
Creates and launches the JPacMan UI.
Author:
Jeroen Roosen

  • Method Details

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Returns:
      The game object this launcher will start when launch() is called.

    • getLevelMap

      protected String getLevelMap()
      The map file used to populate the level.
      Returns:
      The name of the map file.

    • withMapFile

      public Launcher withMapFile(String fileName)
      Set the name of the file containing this level's map.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Map to be used.
      Returns:
      Level corresponding to the given map.

    • makeGame

      public Game makeGame()
      Creates a new game using the level from makeLevel().
      Returns:
      a new Game.

    • makeLevel

      public Level makeLevel()
      Creates a new level. By default this method will use the map parser to parse the default board stored in the board.txt resource.
      Returns:
      A new level.

    • getMapParser

      protected MapParser getMapParser()
      Returns:
      A new map parser object using the factories from getLevelFactory() and getBoardFactory().

    • getBoardFactory

      protected BoardFactory getBoardFactory()
      Returns:
      A new board factory using the sprite store from getSpriteStore().

    • getSpriteStore

      protected PacManSprites getSpriteStore()
      Returns:
      The default PacManSprites.

    • getLevelFactory

      protected LevelFactory getLevelFactory()
      Returns:
      A new factory using the sprites from getSpriteStore() and the ghosts from getGhostFactory().

    • getGhostFactory

      protected GhostFactory getGhostFactory()
      Returns:
      A new factory using the sprites from getSpriteStore().

    • getGameFactory

      protected GameFactory getGameFactory()
      Returns:
      A new factory using the players from getPlayerFactory().

    • getPlayerFactory

      protected PlayerFactory getPlayerFactory()
      Returns:
      A new factory using the sprites from getSpriteStore().

    • addSinglePlayerKeys

      protected void addSinglePlayerKeys(PacManUiBuilder builder)
      Adds key events UP, DOWN, LEFT and RIGHT to a game.
      Parameters:
      builder - The PacManUiBuilder that will provide the UI.

    • launch

      public void launch()
      Creates and starts a JPac-Man game.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of the UI. For more information see Window.dispose(). Precondition: The game was launched first.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      Main execution method for the Launcher.
      Parameters:
      args - The command line arguments - which are ignored.
      Throws:
      IOException - When a resource could not be read.
